DataElement.preferredDefinition: the measurement of the primary tumor by the pathologist (For Breast Cancer use the maximum diameter of the invasive component; if multiple lesions, use the longest lesion).

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to size of a primary pathologic tumor.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Pathologic; caused by or altered by or manifesting disease or pathology.:(NEE-o-PLAY-zha) Abnormal and uncontrolled cell growth.

Concepts.definition: Caused by or altered by or manifesting disease or pathology.

A benign or malignant tissue growth resulting from uncontrolled cell proliferation. Benign neoplastic cells resemble normal cells without exhibiting significant cytologic atypia, while malignant cells exhibit overt signs such as dysplastic features, atypical mitotic figures, necrosis, nuclear pleomorphism, and anaplasia. Representative examples of benign neoplasms include papillomas, cystadenomas, and lipomas; malignant neoplasms include carcinomas, sarcomas, lymphomas, and leukemias.

Property.preferredDefinition: Occurring first in time or sequence; original. (American Heritage Dictionary):Size; the physical magnitude of something.

Concepts.definition: Occurring first in time or sequence; original; of greatest rank or importance or value.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: any measurements, including linear dimensions, volume, and weight, of a patient's tumor.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the size of a primary tumor.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: any measurements, including linear dimensions, volume, and weight, of a patient's tumor.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Measurement; the size or magnitude of something.

Concepts.definition: Annotation used to indicate the size or magnitude of something that was determined by comparison to a standard.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: Move to caBIG context as teh preferred Rep class for Measurement

ClassificationSchemeItems.longName: Cancer Center for Research and Development

ReferenceDocuments.name: COMMENT_224
ReferenceDocuments.description: Add instruction to template form: (cm) Maximum diameter of the invasive component; if multiple lesions, use longest lesion

ReferenceDocuments.name: 2-COMMENT
ReferenceDocuments.description: For DCIS, add instruction: (If pure DCIS,) and (Enter 999.9 for size if not pure DCIS.)

ReferenceDocuments.name: 3-COMMENT
ReferenceDocuments.description: For invasive tumor, add instruction: (Gross) or (Microscopic) and if Microscopic (Maximum diameter of invasive component only.)

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Size of primary breast tumor by palpation

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Size of primary breast tumor by imaging

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Largest diameter of the invasive component

ReferenceDocuments.name: DCP Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Size of tumor at initial presentation (based on imaging measurements):

ReferenceDocuments.name: DCP-Text-2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Size of tumor at initial presentation (based on imaging measurements - long axis) (cm)

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF_Text5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patients primary tumor measure 8 cm or less in anterior to posterior dimension only on axial imaging

ReferenceDocuments.name: Text_6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Primary tumor measurement (8cm or less in anterior to posterior dimension only on axial imaging)
